current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to permit Governors of States to regulate intrastate endangered species and intrastate threatened species, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: was passed in 1973 as a means of protecting and recovering species and has not been substantially revised in over 25 years;
has not achieved its stated goal of recovering threatened species or endangered species;
, less than 1 percent of the total number of species in the United States have been recovered and removed from the list, largely due to data errors or other factors;

text.#text: of the species listed in accordance with the
no comprehensive independent study of the costs or benefits of the
no full accounting of how much the Federal Government and State and local governments spend to implement, enforce, and comply with the
no meaningful effort to account for the costs the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: effectively penalizes landowners for owning endangered species habitat by forcing them to bear the cost of conservation;
has become a tool for environmentalists to undermine, slow down, or halt construction of infrastructure projects, hampering economic growth and employment; and

text.#text: the regulatory listing process under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and some resulting settlements between the litigants and the Federal Government have made the
even more unworkable, to the detriment of species.

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

header.#text: Intrastate endangered species or threatened species

term.#tail: means the Governor of a State in which an intrastate endangered species or intrastate threatened species is present.
means an endangered species that the Governor of a State determines is present only within the State.
means a threatened species that the Governor of a State determines is present only within the State.

text.#text: The Governor of a State may regulate any intrastate endangered species or any intrastate threatened species listed under this section that is listed before the date of enactment of this subsection.
promulgate or enforce any regulation or guidance;
develop or implement a recovery plan; and
establish any goal with respect to the recovery plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the Governor of the State shall, with respect to the management of the intrastate endangered species or intrastate threatened species on any land within the State, have the exclusive authority to, in accordance with the purposes and policy of this Act—
